---
title: "Data Hub Explained"
---

The **Data Hub** is a centralized architecture pattern designed to solve the "spaghetti integration" problem while serving both **analytical** and **operational** use cases.

## The Problem Data Hubs Solve

Without a data hub, systems often connect directly to each other, creating a tangled mess:

```
    ┌─────────┐     ┌─────────┐     ┌─────────┐
    │   EMR   │◄───►│  PACS   │◄───►│   LIS   │
    └────┬────┘     └────┬────┘     └────┬────┘
         │    \    /     │     \   /     │
         │     \  /      │      \ /      │
         │      \/       │       X       │
         │      /\       │      / \      │
         │     /  \      │     /   \     │
    ┌────▼────┐     ┌────▼────┐     ┌────▼────┐
    │   RIS   │◄───►│Billing  │◄───►│ AI App  │
    └─────────┘     └─────────┘     └─────────┘
    
         "Point-to-Point Integration Chaos"
              (n systems = n(n-1)/2 connections)
```

With 6 systems, you need up to **15 connections**. With 100 systems, that's **4,950 connections** to maintain!

## Data Hub Architecture

```
                         ┌────────────────────────────────────────┐
                         │              DATA HUB                  │
    DATA SOURCES         │  ┌─────────────────────────────────┐   │     CONSUMERS
                         │  │     Canonical Data Model        │   │
  ┌──────────────┐       │  │  (Standardized Schema/Format)   │   │   ┌──────────────┐
  │ Relational   │──────►│  └─────────────────────────────────┘   │──►│   Reports    │
  │   (SQL)      │       │                                        │   └──────────────┘
  └──────────────┘       │  ┌─────────────────────────────────┐   │
                         │  │                                 │   │   ┌──────────────┐
  ┌──────────────┐       │  │    ┌───────────────────────┐    │   │──►│ Applications │
  │    JSON      │──────►│  │    │   Storage Layer       │    │   │   └──────────────┘
  │   (APIs)     │       │  │    │  (Database/Files)     │    │   │
  └──────────────┘       │  │    └───────────────────────┘    │   │   ┌──────────────┐
                         │  │              ↑↓                 │   │──►│  Downstream  │
  ┌──────────────┐       │  │    ┌───────────────────────┐    │   │   │   Systems    │
  │    DICOM     │──────►│  │    │ Transformation/ETL    │    │   │   └──────────────┘
  │  (Images)    │       │  │    └───────────────────────┘    │   │
  └──────────────┘       │  │                                 │   │   ┌──────────────┐
                         │  └─────────────────────────────────┘   │──►│  AI/ML       │
  ┌──────────────┐       │                                        │   │  Pipelines   │
  │   HL7/FHIR   │──────►│        ↻ Data Governance               │   └──────────────┘
  │  (Clinical)  │       │        ↻ Master Data Management        │
  └──────────────┘       └────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Key Characteristics

```
┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                     DATA HUB FEATURES                              │
├────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                    │
│  1. CENTRALIZED INTEGRATION POINT                                  │
│     • Single place where all data flows through                    │
│     • Reduces connections from O(n²) to O(n)                       │
│                                                                    │
│  2. CANONICAL DATA MODEL                                           │
│     • Common schema that all systems translate to/from             │
│     • Each source maps once to the hub format                      │
│                                                                    │
│  3. BIDIRECTIONAL DATA FLOW                                        │
│     • Not just for reading (like a warehouse)                      │
│     • Can push data back to operational systems                    │
│                                                                    │
│  4. MASTER DATA MANAGEMENT                                         │
│     • Single source of truth for key entities                      │
│     • (Patients, Providers, Equipment, etc.)                       │
│                                                                    │
└────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Data Hub vs Data Warehouse vs Data Lake

```
┌─────────────────┬──────────────────┬──────────────────┬──────────────────┐
│   Aspect        │    Data Hub      │  Data Warehouse  │    Data Lake     │
├─────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┤
│ Primary Purpose │ Integration +    │ Analytics &      │ Store raw data   │
│                 │ Data Exchange    │ Reporting        │ for exploration  │
├─────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┤
│ Data Flow       │ Bidirectional    │ Mostly inbound   │ Mostly inbound   │
│                 │ (in AND out)     │ (read-heavy)     │ (read-heavy)     │
├─────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┤
│ Data Format     │ Canonical model  │ Structured       │ Raw (any format) │
│                 │ (standardized)   │ (star schema)    │                  │
├─────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┤
│ Use Cases       │ System-to-system │ Business Intel   │ Data Science     │
│                 │ communication    │ Dashboards       │ ML Training      │
├─────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┤
│ Latency         │ Near real-time   │ Batch (daily)    │ Varies           │
└─────────────────┴──────────────────┴──────────────────┴──────────────────┘
```

## When to Use a Data Hub?

A data hub makes sense when:

1. You have **many systems** that need to share data with each other
2. You need **bidirectional** data flow (not just analytics)
3. You want a **single source of truth** for master data (patients, studies, etc.)
4. You're dealing with **multiple data formats** that need standardization
5. **Operational integration** is as important as analytics
